meanings.definition: Justify or necessitate (a certain course of action)
meanings.sent1: His behavior warrants further investigation by the authorities.
meanings.sent2: The evidence warrants a closer look at the case.
meanings.sent3: The unusual circumstances warranted a second look.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to the project warrants recognition.
meanings.sent5: The severity of the storm warrants immediate action.

meanings.sent1: The warranty on the product warrants its quality.
meanings.sent2: His reputation as an honest person is a strong warrant of trust.
meanings.sent3: The written guarantee serves as a warrant for the purchase.
meanings.sent4: Her sincere apology was a warrant of her regret.
meanings.sent5: The certificate of authenticity acts as a warrant for the artwork's value.

meanings.definition: Legal document authorizing an action or search
meanings.sent1: The police officer presented a search warrant to enter the premises.
meanings.sent2: The judge signed the warrant for the arrest of the suspect.
meanings.sent3: The warrant allowed the authorities to search the property.
meanings.sent4: The warrant specified the details of the authorized action.
meanings.sent5: The warrant was issued by the court for the search operation.
